DOC.brief_summary: The purpose national multicentre randomize control trial compare ventilation strategy use low tidal volumes high respiratory rate ventilation strategy use high tidal volume low respiratory rate intubate ventilate intensive care unit ( ICU ) patient without Acute Respiratory Distress Syndrome ( ARDS ) start ventilation . Participating centre The Netherlands include total 952 adult patient admit intensive care unit without ARDS . Patients randomize ventilate either strategy lower tidal volume ( 4 6 ml/kg predict body weight ( PBW ) ) strategy high tidal volume ( 8 10 ml/kg PBW ) . Patients assessed every day day 28 discharge intensive care unit , whichever come first , day 28 day 90 . Primary endpoint number ventilator-free day day 28 . Secondary endpoint ICU- hospital length stay ( LOS ) - mortality , incidence development ARDS , pneumonia , atelectasis , pneumothorax , cumulative use duration sedative , neuromuscular block agent , incidence ICU delirium ICU acquire weakness , patient-ventilator asynchrony need decrease instrumental dead space .
DOC.detailed_description: Research question : Does mechanical ventilation lower tidal volume , compare mechanical ventilation high tidal volume , increase number ventilator-free day day 28 patient without ARDS start ventilation ? Study Design : An investigator-initiated , national , multicenter , parallel randomize control two-arm trial . Centers : Five center The Netherlands participate trial ; - Academic Medical Center , University Amsterdam - Gelre Hospitals , Apeldoorn - Leiden University Medical Center , Leiden - Tergooi , Hilversum - Vrije Universiteit University Medical Center , Amsterdam - Westfries Gasthuis , Hoorn Ethics Approval : The Institutional Review Board Academic Medical Center approve study 15 May 2014 Monitoring : - Monitoring patient safety review safety issue perform designated independent Data Safety Monitoring Board ( DSMB ) .The DSMB watch ethic conduct study accordance Declaration Helsinki . This study compare two treatment strategy use standard care , therefore related serious adverse event ( SAEs ) expect . All unexpected relate possibly related adverse event report DSMB - An independent monitor perform clinical trial monitoring . On-site monitoring comprise control presence completeness research dossier inform consent form , source data check perform . Every participate center visit least every year . Study Population : Adult ICU-patients without ARDS expect duration ventilation longer 24 hour , within 1 hour initiation ventilation admittance ICU already intubate ventilated admission . Sample Size Calculation : The required sample size calculate use data recently publish meta-analysis secondary analysis meta-analysis use individual patient data study perform ICU patient [ submit publication ] . The sample size compute basis hypothesis ventilation lower tidal volume associate reduction one day ventilation . A sample size 397 patient group 80 % statistical power detect difference one ventilator-free day alive day 28 ICU admission , mean 23 24 day respectively . Assuming common standard deviation 5 use two group t-test 0.05 two-sided significance level . The sample size increase 20 % correct dropouts lose follow ( i.e. , patient could transfer hospital ) , mean group contain 476 patient . Methods : Patients participate intensive care unit ( ICU ) screen randomize within 1 hour start mechanical ventilation unit . Demographic data screen patient regardless meeting enrollment criterion record ( registry : age , gender , type surgery ) . Randomization perform use dedicate , password protect , SSL-encrypted website . Randomization sequence generate dedicated computer randomization software program use random block size stratify per center per intubation location ( i.e. , ICU ICU admittance operation room emergency room ) . No block applied trial factor . Due nature intervention , blind possible . Patients randomly assign 1:1 ratio low tidal volume ventilation ( 4 6 ml/kg PBW ) ( 'lower tidal volume'-arm ) ventilation high tidal volume ( 8 10 ml/kg PBW ) ( 'higher tidal volume'-arm ) . The allowed ventilation mode volume control ventilation pressure support ventilation . The inspiration-to-expiration ratio volume control ventilation 1:2 . With volume control ventilation inspiration time pause set 25 % 10 % respectively . With pressure support ventilation high possible pressure rise chosen , cycle set 25 % . The inspired oxygen fraction 0.21 high maintain oxygen saturation 90 92 % and/or PaO2 > 7.3 10.7 kPa ( 55 80 mmHg ) . The respiratory rate adjust maintain blood pH 7.25 7.45 . In case metabolic acidosis - alkalosis , low high normal PaCO2 accept , leave discretion attend physician . The low level positive end-expiratory pressure 5 cmH2O . Recruitment maneuver allow , deem necessary , left discretion attend physician . In arm tidal volume titrate per PBW , calculate accord previously use formula : 50 + 0.91 x ( centimeter height - 152.4 ) male 45.5 + 0.91 x ( centimeter height - 152.4 ) female . - Patients randomize 'lower tidal volume'-arm start tidal volume 6 ml/kg PBW . The tidal volume size decrease step 1 ml/kg PBW per hour , minimum 4 ml/kg PBW , unless patient suffers severe dyspnea ( identify increase respiratory rate > 35 breath per minute accompany increase level discomfort without need sedation ) unacceptable acidosis.The follow measure take prevent respiratory acidosis : increase respiratory rate decrease instrumental dead space shorten ventilation tubing , limit dead space ventilation . Patients randomize low tidal volume arm may need little support ventilator switch pressure support ventilation , minimum 5 cmH2O use . In case result tidal volume exceed 6 ml/kg PBW must accept - Patients randomize 'higher tidal volume'-arm start tidal volume 10 ml/kg PBW . With volume-controlled ventilation plateau pressure exceed 25 cm H2O . Only plateau pressure exceed 25 cm H2O tidal volume decrease step 1 ml/kg PBW per hour , minimum 8 ml/kg PBW ( table 1 ) . With pressure support , tidal volume titration variation pressure support level . Other mode ventilation allowed.Patients randomize high tidal volume arm generally need support ventilator switch pressure support ventilation , maximal airway pressure exceed 25 cm H2O [ 2 ] . In case result tidal volume remain 10 ml/kg PBW must accept . - Daily assessment ability breathe pressure support ventilation require soon FiO2 ≤ 0.4 PEEP level FiO2 level lower day . Other mode ventilation allowed.In addition , ventilator switch pressure support ventilation moment attend nurse physician consider patient awake enough breathe pressure support ventilation . Assessment ability breathe pressure support also require case patient-ventilator asynchrony notice ( ineffective breathing ; double triggering , use assessory respiratory muscle ) . A patient assume ready extubation follow criterion meet least 30 minute , final decision extubation make attend physician : - Responsive cooperative - Adequate cough reflex - PaO2/FiO2 > 200 mmHg FiO2 ≤ 40 % - Respiratory rate 8 30/minute - No sign respiratory distress ( i.e. , mark accessory muscle use , abdominal paradox , diaphoresis , mark dyspnea ) - Pressure support level < 7 cm H2O ( low tidal volume arm ) < 12 cm H2O ( high tidal volume arm ) - Hemodynamically stable ( systolic blood pressure 80 160 mmHg heart rate 40 130/min ) uncontrolled arrhythmia - Temperature > 36.0oC < 38.5oC In high tidal volume arm physician nurse may decide low pressure support level first ( i.e. , extubation ) . For , pressure support level lower step-wise step 2 5 cm H2O per hour < 7 cm H2O . If tolerate accord condition mention , pressure support level set back maintain tidal volume per randomization patient assess extubation follow day . If patient becomes able breathe without assistance subsequently require additional ventilation within 28 day randomization , tidal volume protocol resume . Non-invasive ventilation allow , try comparable tidal volume invasive ventilation , per randomization . Sedation follow local guideline sedation participate unit . In general , guideline favor use analgo-sedation hypno-sedation , use bolus continuous infusion sedate agent , use sedation score . Nurses determine level sedation least 3 time per day . The adequacy sedation patient evaluate use Richmond Agitation Sedation Scale ( RASS ) . A RASS score -2 0 see adequate sedation . As state , sedation adjustment never do allow low high tidal volume . The goal sedation reduce agitation , stress fear ; reduce oxygen consumption ( heart rate , blood pressure minute volume measure continuously ) ; reduce physical resistance to- fear daily care medical examination . Patient comfort primary goal . Statistical Analysis : - The primary outcome , number ventilator-free day day 28 ICU admission , analyze use Cox 's regression . Possible imbalance group model Cox model . P-values 0.05 used statistical significance . When appropriate , statistical uncertainty express 95 % confidence level . - Continuous normally distribute variable express mean standard deviation normally distribute median interquartile range . Categorical variable express n ( % ) . To test group Student 's test use , continuous data normally distribute Mann-Whitney U test use . Categorical variable compare Chi-square test Fisher 's exact test . Time dependent data analyze use proportional hazard model adjust possible imbalance patient ' baseline characteristic . Patient characteristic compare described appropriate statistic . - The goal primary analysis quantify effect lower tidal volume vs. high tidal volume number ventilator free day alive day 28 . Statistical analysis base intention-to-treat principle . We also perform per-protocol analysis , compare patient receive low tidal volume patient receive high tidal volume . Other secondary analysis include analysis patient pneumonia versus patient without pneumonia , patient fulfil definition mild ARDS versus patient fulfill definition , patient sepsis versus patient without sepsis .
DOC.criteria: Admission ICU participate trial Need intubation Within 1 hour admission operation room emergency room ( still intubate ventilate ) , within 1 hour start invasive ventilation ICU An expected duration ventilation > 24 hour Age le 18 year Patients previously randomize PReVENT Patients participate interventional trial Patients clinical diagnosis ARDS accord Berlin definition Patients PaO2/FiO2 < 200 mm Hg hypoxia presumably cause cardiac failure fluid overload Invasive ventilation longer 12 hour directly precede admission Patients suspect confirmed pregnancy Patients increase uncontrollable intracranial pressure ( ≥18 mmHg ) Patients GOLD classification III IV chronic obstructive pulmonary disease ( COPD ) Patients asthmatic status Patients premorbid restrictive pulmonary disease ( evidence chronic interstitial infiltration previous chest radiograph ) Patients new proven pulmonary thromboembolism Patients previous pneumectomy lobectomy
